siteMetadata.title: rantum.dev
siteMetadata.subtitle: digital dwelling of andrew maury. digital developer @ecomloop in burlingame, ca. san matean nantucketer on a rantum scoot.

frontmatter.title: Push extents
frontmatter.description: The world is ready to move forward with consequences set aside. Find the right ways to push the extents of others' beliefs by being more impactful than forceful.

frontmatter.title: Adjusting approach
frontmatter.description: The approach to the pandemic is changing over time, rather than as a response to new methods or protocols. It's a frustrating situation for everyone and the individual approaches will vary more widely moving forward.

frontmatter.title: What comes in next stage of pandemic
frontmatter.description: summer quickly fades. school begins with questions amiss. as to what comes next

frontmatter.title: Weigh risks personally
frontmatter.description: Weigh personal risks. Don't rely on general guidelines, especially with irreversible consequences.

frontmatter.title: Set clear guidelines
frontmatter.description: It's not right to expect others to understand boundaries. The stakes are high and bad habits lead to unintended consequences.

frontmatter.title: Reduce risk when unknowns persist
frontmatter.description: Conditions improve can only improve by reducing unknowns.

frontmatter.title: Slow down & be more deliberate with time investments
frontmatter.description: It's strikingly quiet in the mornings, masking the hidden chaos in the world. This won't change overnight. Slow down and be more deliberate with time investments.

frontmatter.title: Develop platforms to help others lead and connect
frontmatter.description: It's much harder to take action. It's time to get to work. Looking back months later, consider what good work can come out of this time.

frontmatter.title: Help others discover right questions to ask
frontmatter.description: Help others discover right the questions to ask rather than assuming prior knowledge - or implying best next steps.
